member.summary: The cursor that appears when the mouse is positioned over a horizontal splitter bar.

member.summary: The I-beam cursor, which is used to show where the text cursor appears when the mouse is clicked.

member.summary: The cursor that indicates that a particular region is invalid for the current operation.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is not moving, but the window can be scrolled in a horizontal direction.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is not moving, but the window can be scrolled in a vertical direction.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally to the right.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally and vertically upward and to the left.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally and vertically downward and to the right.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling vertically in a downward direction.

member.summary: The cursor that appears during wheel operations when the mouse is moving and the window is scrolling horizontally to the left.

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout
member.summary: The layout used when mapping a texture on an object in the 3D scene.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.Stretched
member.summary: Stretches the texture along the X and Y axes until it fits the object. It does not preserve the original texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.Fitted
member.summary: Stretches the texture until its smaller dimension fits the object. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.Centered
member.summary: Similar to fitted. When used on the background object it also preserves the real original texture dimensions.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.Tiled
member.summary: Repeats the texture along the X and Y axes. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.StretchedToWidth
member.summary: Stretches the texture by width until it fits. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.StretchedToHeight
member.summary: Stretches the texture by height until it fits. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapLayout.CropFitted
member.summary: Stretches the texture until its larger dimension fits the object. This layout mode preserves the texture dimensions ratio (aspect).

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapMode
member.summary: Defines how textures are mapped on the surfaces of an object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapMode.RelativeToObject
member.summary: Mapping is relative to the object. A mapping layout can be specified.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapMode.RelativeToViewer
member.summary: Mapping is relative to the viewer.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MapMode.Sphere
member.summary: Environmental mapping used for special visual effects like reflection.

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MarginMode
member.summary: Possible modes for fitting a chart into the chart area.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MarginMode.None
member.summary: The chart will not try to align to the chart area.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MarginMode.Fit
member.summary: The chart will stretch along X and Y in order to fill as much as possible of the chart area preserving the chart proportions.

member.name: F:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.MarginMode.Stretch
member.summary: The chart will stretch along X and Y in order to fill as much as possible of the chart area without breaking outside. Does not preserve the chart proportions.

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.BevelAndEmbossFilter
member.summary: When present in a ImageFilters collection the BevelAndEmbossFilter class instructs the component to apply a bevel and emboss effect on the image. This effect is different than the bevel and emboss filter applied in Photoshop because it works by combining three samples of the image - original, highlight and dark. The different types of the bevel and emboss define how these images are combined.

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.Frame
member.summary: The Frame object controls the frame applied on a particular object. The frame itself consists of four elements - the outer bevel, the bevel distance, the inner bevel and the frame border. With the help of the InnerStyle and OuterStyle properties you can control inner and outer bevel style. The BevelDistance property specifies the distance between the inner and the outer bevel. The HasBorder property allows you to enable or disable the frame border.

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.LightingFilter
member.summary: When present in a ImageFilters collection the LightingFilter class instructs the component to apply a lighting effect on the image. This effect is achieved by creating a bump based on the original image alpha values and then lighting calculations are performed for each pixel in the image.

member.name: T:Xceed.Chart.GraphicsCore.OffsetDragOperation
member.summary: This class represents the offset interactivity operation. The offset feature of the control enables the end user to move the chart margins by pressing the mouse button and then dragging the mouse over the control. The chart will move accordingly and the margins of the current chart will also change accordingly.
